items.title: K-Meter fetches JACK ports improperly
items.body:
### Describe the bug

When configuring K-Meter (standalone) for use with JACK, the list of 'outputs' appears to be a list of client output ports and the list of 'inputs' is a list of client input ports; however, selecting an 'output' does not connect the named client's output to K-Meters _input_ ports, but rather attempts to connect K-Meter's _output_ port to that client's (often non-existent) _input_ port.

Take the following image for example - 'system has both input _and_ output ports, so it appears in both input and output dropdowns.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6024227/88955240-433db680-d261-11ea-8a07-4b8c7e354736.png)

However, this problem becomes apparent when looking at the 'strawberry client'. This client _only_ has output ports, but is listed in the K-Meter output dropdown as opposed to the _input_ dropdown.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6024227/88955420-84ce6180-d261-11ea-877f-f7cc5d256145.png)

### Steps to reproduce

List *all* steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Start K-Meter
2. Set device type to 'JACK'
3. Attempt to connect

### Expected behavior

'Output' and 'Input' client lists are swapped.

### Environment (please complete the following information)

 - OS: Gentoo x86_64
 - Plugin (not really a plugin): Precompiled K-Meter standalone for stereo (sha256: `5b021e3f007a04749774bd994b538e56b1656ffb92ba418ae8eb6c9ab9806cb2  kmeter_stereo_x64`)
 - JACK version: JACK2 v1.9.14 (`jackdmp version 1.9.14 tmpdir /dev/shm protocol 8`)

Did you compile K-Meter yourself? no, I don't want to deal with JUCE right now.
